task.title: Manage Instances
task.shortdesc: This screen allows you to view a list of your instances, create new instances, and connect to, reboot, stop, terminate, and delete instances. You can page through the list of instances by clicking the navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen.

step.cmd: Click on any column header to toggle sorting the list of instances in ascending or descending order by the selected column.
Type some search text into the Search text box to filter the list of instances.
You can filter the list of instances by selecting the filtering criteria from the filtering drop-down list boxes.

task.title: Viewing Details of an Instance
task.shortdesc: You can expand an instance entry in the list to see details about the instance, including associated volumes and tags.

step.cmd: Click the name of the instance in the list of instances.
step.info: The area beneath the instance name will expand to a tabbed interface.

step.cmd: Click the General tab to see a panel of detailed information about the instance, include the volume associated with the instance.
Click the Volumes tab to see a list of volumes attached to the instance.
Click the Tags tab to see a list of tags associated with the instance.
Click the Launch new instance button. The Launch Instance dialog box will appear.
Select the instance and then select Connect from the More actions menu at the top of the list. The Connect to instance dialog box will appear with further instructions.
Select the instance and then select Reboot from the More actions menu at the top of the list. The Reboot instance dialog box will appear.
Select the instance and then select Stop from the More actions menu at the top of the list. The Stop instance dialog box will appear.
Select the instance and then select Terminate from the More actions menu at the top of the list. The Terminate instance dialog box will appear.

task.title: More Actions
task.shortdesc: The More actions button at the top of the Manage instances window contains additional actions you can perform on one or more instances.

step.cmd: Select Launch more like this displays a dialog that allows you to create and customize an instance like the selected instance.
Select Get console output to display the console output from the selected instance.
Select Attach volume to attach a volume to the selected instance.
Select Detach volume to detach a volume from the selected instance.
Select Associate IP address to associate an IP address with the selected volume.
Select Disassociate IP address to disassociate an IP address from the selected volume.
